hero.description: Providing a safe, nurturing environment where your children can learn, play, and grow. Our experienced staff creates engaging activities that promote development and creativity.

about.title: Welcome to Kindergarten
about.description: At Garderie Mirabel 1&2, we believe every child deserves a nurturing environment where they can explore, learn, and grow with confidence. Our experienced educators are dedicated to providing quality early childhood education through play-based learning, helping children develop essential social, emotional, and cognitive skills that will serve them throughout their lives.
about.videoTitle: A Place to Learn and Grow
about.videoDescription: Our kindergarten provides a nurturing and stimulating environment where children can explore, create, and grow into confident individuals. We focus on play-based learning and holistic development to prepare them for a bright future.

ourStory.title: Our
ourStory.subtitle: Discover how Garderie Mirabel 1&2 became a trusted partner in your children's development journey.

founding.title: How We Started
founding.description: Founded in 2015, Garderie Mirabel 1&2 began with a simple mission: to create a safe, nurturing environment where children can thrive. Our founders, passionate about early childhood education, wanted to establish a place where families feel like home and children develop confidence, creativity, and a love for learning.

mission.title: Our Mission Today
mission.description: Today, we continue to honor that vision by providing exceptional childcare services that support each child's unique development. We believe in fostering independence, creativity, and social skills through play-based learning and individualized attention.

visual.title: Built with Love
visual.description: Every corner of our facility is designed with children's safety, comfort, and development in mind.

ourTeam.title: Meet Our
ourTeam.description: Our dedicated educators bring passion, experience, and expertise to create the best environment for your children.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our daycare services, enrollment process, and policies.
faq.contactMessage: We're here to help! Contact us directly for personalized assistance.

0.question: What are your enrollment requirements?
0.answer: We accept children aged 0-5 years. Required documents include immunization records, emergency contacts, and a completed enrollment form. We also require a tour of our facility before enrollment.

1.question: What are your operating hours?
1.answer: We are open Monday through Friday from 6:30 AM to 6:00 PM. We are closed on weekends and major holidays. Extended hours may be available upon request.

2.question: What is your fee structure?
2.answer: Our fees vary based on age group and program selection. We offer full-time and part-time options. Please contact us for current pricing and payment plans. We accept various payment methods for your convenience.

3.question: Do you offer subsidized spots?
3.answer: Yes, we participate in government subsidy programs. We can help you determine your eligibility and assist with the application process. Contact our administration for more details.

4.question: What safety measures do you have in place?
4.answer: We maintain strict safety protocols including secure entry systems, background checks for all staff, emergency preparedness plans, and regular safety drills. Our facility is regularly inspected and certified.

5.question: How do you handle medical emergencies?
5.answer: All staff are trained in first aid and CPR. We have established emergency procedures and maintain emergency contacts for all children. We work closely with local emergency services when needed.

6.question: What are your sick child policies?
6.answer: Children showing signs of illness must stay home to protect others. We follow public health guidelines for return-to-care requirements. We maintain detailed health records and communicate with parents about any health concerns.

7.question: What meals and snacks do you provide?
7.answer: We provide nutritious meals and snacks prepared fresh daily in our licensed kitchen. We accommodate dietary restrictions and allergies. Menus are planned by nutrition professionals and posted weekly.

8.question: How do you communicate with parents?
8.answer: We use multiple communication methods including daily reports, photo sharing, newsletters, and parent-teacher conferences. We maintain an open-door policy and encourage regular communication.

9.question: What is your approach to discipline?
9.answer: We use positive guidance techniques focusing on teaching appropriate behavior. Our approach emphasizes natural consequences, redirection, and helping children understand the impact of their actions.

10.question: What educational curriculum do you follow?
10.answer: We follow a play-based learning curriculum that meets provincial early learning standards. Our program focuses on social, emotional, physical, and cognitive development through age-appropriate activities.

11.question: Do you offer extracurricular activities?
11.answer: Yes, we offer various enrichment programs including music, art, physical education, and language development. These activities are integrated into our daily schedule and age-appropriate for each group.

12.question: How do you prepare children for school?
12.answer: Our kindergarten preparation program focuses on school readiness skills including social skills, independence, following routines, and academic foundations. We work closely with local schools to ensure smooth transitions.

blogs.title: Our
blogs.subtitle: Discover helpful tips, educational insights, and stories from our daycare community to support your child's development journey.

3.title: Healthy Snacks That Kids Actually Love
3.excerpt: Balanced nutrition is essential for children's optimal development. Our chef daily prepares fresh, colorful, and nutritious snacks that appeal to little palates. From fruits cut into fun shapes to vegetables served with tasty dips, we make healthy eating attractive. Our menus respect all food allergies and prioritize quality local ingredients. These healthy eating habits, developed from a young age, will accompany children throughout their growth and contribute to their overall well-being and lifelong health habits.
3.author: Julie Tremblay

4.title: Creating Safe Spaces for Exploration and Learning
4.excerpt: Safety is our absolute priority at Garderie Mirabel. We have designed every space to encourage children's natural exploration while maintaining a perfectly secure environment. Our facilities include advanced surveillance systems, soft-surface play areas, and strict safety protocols. Every corner is designed to minimize risks while maximizing learning opportunities. This approach allows children to develop their confidence and autonomy in a protected setting that also reassures parents about their children's well-being.
4.author: Marie-Claire Dubois

5.title: Building Independence in Young Children
5.excerpt: Encouraging autonomy in young children is a delicate art that requires patience and expertise. Our educators support each child in developing their independence through activities adapted to their age and pace. Whether learning to put away toys, choosing activities, or resolving small conflicts with peers, we guide children toward greater autonomy. This caring approach strengthens their self-esteem and prepares them to face future challenges with confidence. Independence acquired at a young age forms a solid foundation for their personal development.
5.author: Sophie Martin

6.title: Calculate the Cost of a Daycare Space in 2025
6.excerpt: Wondering how much a daycare space costs for your child in 2025? The Quebec Ministry of Finance provides an official simulator that allows you to quickly and easily estimate the cost of a space according to your family situation. This practical tool takes into account various factors (income, number of children, type of daycare service, etc.) and gives you a personalized estimate. üëâ Access the simulator from the [Quebec Ministry of Finance]. At Garderie Mirabel, we know it's important for parents to have a clear vision of the costs related to their children's care. This useful link is here to help you better plan your family budget.
6.author: Marie-Claire Dubois

7.title: Complete Guide to Family Allowances in Quebec
7.excerpt: Did you know that the Quebec government offers several financial assistance programs to support families? Family allowances can significantly reduce your costs related to childcare and healthcare. The Quebec Child Assistance Program pays up to $2,817 per year per child depending on your family situation. Additionally, the tax credit for childcare expenses can cover up to 75% of your daycare fees. üëâ Discover all available programs on [Retraite Qu√©bec] and calculate your benefits. At Garderie Mirabel, we encourage parents to explore these resources to lighten the financial burden and allow more families to access quality childcare services.
7.author: Marie-Claire Dubois

8.title: Essential Resources for New Parents in Quebec
8.excerpt: Becoming a parent in Quebec comes with many important administrative steps. Registering your child with RAMQ must be done within 30 days of birth to ensure complete health coverage. The [Na√Ætre et grandir] website offers expert advice on child development, nutrition, and daily care, specifically adapted to the Quebec context. For emergencies, keep the Quebec Poison Control Center number handy: 1 800 463-5060. We also recommend familiarizing yourself with Quebec's vaccination schedule available on [Quebec.ca]. At Garderie Mirabel, we work in partnership with these official resources to provide the best care for your children.
8.author: Julie Tremblay
